docs.lead_paragraph: SIMON--Leonard S. The Board and Staff of Volunteers In Medicine-Berkshires mourn with great sadness the untimely passing of our founder, friend and colleague on December 24, 2010. We join with our volunteers and patients to offer our most heartfelt condolences to his wife, Marion, sons Andrew and Jon and their families. Leonard's vision, leadership, passion, dedication and generosity have been instrumental in bringing free health care services to those without insurance or the ability to pay. His legacy will serve as an inspiration to all of us to continue his endeavors. Arthur M. Peisner, Chairman Board of Trustees Volunteers In Medicine- Berkshires

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SIMON, LEONARD S

docs.lead_paragraph: Customer satisfaction with credit unions is starting to decline, according to the results of a new study released this month, and it may be because of all of the new customers looking for a better experience.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just as the Senate passed a bill to cover the medical costs of 9/11 rescue and cleanup workers, a federal judge in Manhattan said on Wednesday that payments to a subset of those workers - the more than 10,000 plaintiffs who settled their lawsuits with the city last month -- must start going out by late January.

headline.main: 9/11 Payments Must Start Next Month, Judge Says

docs.abstract: The first checks, which go to all plaintiffs who accepted a settlement, will amount to $3,250 apiece.
